definition: to discharge smoke/to fume with rage
to emit/to give off/to send out (or up, forth)/to brave/to face/reckless/to falsely adopt (sb's identity etc)/to feign/(literary) to cover
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: Remember- if you smoke proper after sex you're doing it too fast.
sentences.chinese: 記着，要是你在嘿咻後冒煙了，證明你整得太快了。

sentences.english: Reported smoke coming from the 3 after the reactor has stopped smoking.
sentences.chinese: 報道稱，此前冒出白煙的3號反應堆已經停止冒煙。

sentences.english: No chemical mystery there: Where there’s fire, there’s smoke.
sentences.chinese: 這裏沒有化學的祕密，哪裏着火哪裏就冒煙。

sentences.english: Some seem to be still smoking.
Remember- if you smoke after sex you're doing it too fast.
sentences.chinese: 記着，倘使你在嘿咻後冒煙了，證明你整得太快了。

sentences.english: She could see a chimney smoking in the nearby village.
sentences.chinese: 她可以看到附近村子裏的煙囪在冒煙。

sentences.english: The road is littered with the charred and smoking remains of Colonel Gaddafi’s military.
sentences.chinese: 路上遍佈卡扎菲上校軍隊燒焦和正在冒煙的殘骸。

sentences.english: When the oil ran out, the flax smoked and they quenched it.
sentences.chinese: 油用盡了，麻冒煙，他們就吹滅。

sentences.english: The factory chimneys vomited (out) smoke (all day).
sentences.chinese: 煙囪冒煙處，未必酒菜香。

sentences.english: They could see the smoke of the burning lint-stock.
sentences.chinese: 人們看到點燃了的引火線在冒煙。

sentences.english: GASP】The policeman heard the gasps of a boy in the smoky room.
sentences.chinese: 救火員聽到冒煙的房間裏有個男孩的喘息聲。

sentences.english: That's 'always smoking' in Nahuatl, ' says a man in Cholula, using the Aztec language still spoken locally.
sentences.chinese: 在那瓦特語中那是一直在冒煙的意思。

sentences.english: The doorkeeper gave the alarm as soon as he saw the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 守門人一看見冒煙就發出警報。

sentences.english: There is a burning man hovering in the air over a grille in the Smoldering Corpse Bar.
sentences.chinese: 有一個焚燒中的人，飄浮在冒煙屍體酒吧的鐵柵上方。
子彈把塵土打得噗噗直冒煙。

sentences.english: 8Smoke rose from his nostrils; consuming fire came from his mouth, burning coals blazed out of it.
sentences.chinese: 從他鼻孔冒煙上騰，從他口中發火焚燒。連炭也着了

definition: to ignite/to light a fire/to agitate/to start an engine/ignition/fig. to stir up trouble
to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
running in opposite direction (buses, trains, ferries etc)
